name: Rashel Rojas
about_yourself: Hi! I'm a Computer Science graduate from Columbia University's School of Engineering. I'm skilled in backend development and I'm interested in Software Engineering. I enjoy strength training, salsa dancing, and hanging out with friends. I'm currently seeking full-time Software Engineering jobs!

education.name: Bronx Science
education.classes: AP Computer Science A, App Development, AP Statistics, AP Calc BC

education.name: Columbia University
education.classes: Data Structures, Intro to Python, Advanced Programming in C, Intro to Databases, Analysis of Algorithms, Operating Systems

responsibilities.resp_1: Completed 12-weeks of structured curriculum-based learning covering core Production Engineering topics, supplemented with events/workshops hosted by industry experts
responsibilities.resp_2: Created an open-source personal portfolio website template using Python, MySQL, Jinja, Flask, JavaScript, Docker, Nginx, and unittest with automated testing and deployment workflows using CI/CD
responsibilities.resp_3: Set up system and container monitoring, alerting, and visualization using Prometheus and Grafana

responsibilities.resp_1: Optimized storage system of a pre-trade analysis tool called Troodon, which generates and stores Bond Analysis Worksheets (BAWs) into a local folder used by the CLO Secondary Trading desk of 15 traders
responsibilities.resp_2: Created a Procmon script in Slang (GS proprietary language) to transfer BAWs older than 2 years from local to cloud storage in Goldman Sachsâ€™ main cloud storage system, OBS2
responsibilities.resp_3: Successful in freeing up hundreds of gigabytes of space, which came at a crucial time considering local storage was at 90% capacity and the recent uptick in CLO trading

responsibilities2.resp_1: Enhanced Goldman Sachs Marquee Data APIs to provide new API parameter to allow clients to filter assets from their composite asset collections using Java, Vert.x, IntelliJ, and GitLab
responsibilities2.resp_2: Learned about financial data referencing and cross identifiers

responsibilities.resp_1: Worked under Babak Mozaffari on a team of 13 software engineers on the development of OpenShift/Kubernetes operators for Red Hat and upstream open-source products
responsibilities.resp_2: Implemented CR/CRD validation and ConsoleLink creation for 5 operators (3scale, Teiid, Apicurio, Hawtio, Syndesis) using Go and verified operator deployment via the OpenShift Container Platform

hobbies.caption: I'm on my university's bellydancing troupe, CU Raqs! We host a variety of classes throughout the semester and host our own annual spring show where we're joined by several other dance groups.
I enjoy strength training. My goal is to be able to do 10 pull ups one day :)
I'm always looking for new projects to work on. Currently, I'm helping a friend develop an iOS music collaboration app.
